design_philosophy.aesthetic: Retro Pixel Art meets High-Fidelity Textures
principles: Fusion: Mix 8-bit sprites with rich, realistic textures (wood, parchment) for UI depth.
Emotion: Witty, nostalgic, and epic. Every interaction should feel 'crunchy' and satisfying.
Content: Story-first. The UI should recede when exploring, and pop when interacting.
Contrast: Bright pixel art characters against moody, deep ocean backgrounds.

colors.theme_strategy: Dark mode default for world, Warm Parchment for UI panels

layout_system.grid_strategy: Bento Grid for Inventory, Full-screen Canvas for Adventure

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. CREATE 'AdventureContext' to manage state (currentLocation, inventory, activeQuest, dialogueQueue).
2. IMPLEMENT 'LocationEngine' that renders different backgrounds and hotspots based on current location ID.
3. USE the provided texture URLs as background-image for the UI panels (Dialogue, Quest Log) to give a rich RPG feel.
4. REUSE existing CSS animations from App.css (e.g., animate-float for items, animate-shake for danger).
5. ENSURE all text in the DialogueOverlay uses the 'VT323' font for that retro RPG readability.
6. MOCK the interaction data (dialogue trees, item drops) in a separate 'gameData.js' file to keep components clean.
7. ADD 'data-testid' to all interactive elements (hotspots, choices, inventory slots) for testing.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN
